verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered, <S%H6030><s%>
"In truth <S%H551><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that this is so, <S%H3651><s%> But how <S%H4100><s%> can a man <S%H582><s%> be in the right <S%H6663><s%> before <S%H5973><s%> God <S%H410><s%>?
"If <S%H518><s%> one wished <S%H2654><s%> to dispute <S%H7378><s%> with Him, He could not answer <S%H6030><s%> Him once <S%H259><s%> in a thousand <S%H505><s%> [times.]
"Wise <S%H2450><s%> in heart <S%H3824><s%> and mighty <S%H533><s%> in strength, <S%H3581><s%> Who <S%H4310><s%> has defied <S%H7185><s%> <S%H413><s%> Him without <S%H9608><s%> harm <S%H9608><s%>?
"[It is God] who removes <S%H6275><s%> the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> they know <S%H3045><s%> not [how,] When <S%H834><s%> He overturns <S%H2015><s%> them in His anger; <S%H639><s%>
Who shakes <S%H7264><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> out of its place, <S%H4725><s%> And its pillars <S%H5982><s%> tremble; <S%H6426><s%>
Who commands <S%H559><s%> the sun <S%H2775><s%> not to shine, <S%H2224><s%> And sets <S%H2856><s%> a seal <S%H2856><s%> upon the stars; <S%H3556><s%>
Who alone <S%H905><s%> stretches <S%H5186><s%> out the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> And tramples <S%H1869><s%> down <S%H1869><s%> the waves <S%H1116><s%> of the sea; <S%H3220><s%>
Who makes <S%H6213><s%> the Bear, <S%H5906><s%> Orion, <S%H3685><s%> and the Pleiades, <S%H3598><s%> And the chambers <S%H2315><s%> of the south; <S%H8486><s%>

Who does <S%H6213><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> things, <S%H1419><s%> unfathomable <S%H2714><s%>, <S%H369><s%> <S%H5704><s%> And wondrous <S%H6381><s%> works <S%H6381><s%> without <S%H5704><s%> <S%H369><s%> number. <S%H4557><s%>
"Were He to pass <S%H5674><s%> by me, I would not see <S%H7200><s%> Him; Were He to move <S%H2498><s%> past <S%H2498><s%> [me,] I would not perceive <S%H995><s%> Him.

"Were He to snatch <S%H2862><s%> away, <S%H2862><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> could restrain <S%H7725><s%> Him? Who <S%H4310><s%> could say <S%H559><s%> to Him, 'What <S%H4100><s%> art Thou doing <S%H6213><s%>?'
"God <S%H433><s%> will not turn <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> His anger; <S%H639><s%> Beneath <S%H8478><s%> Him crouch <S%H7817><s%> the helpers <S%H5826><s%> of Rahab. <S%H7293><s%>
"How <S%H637><s%> then <S%H637><s%> <S%H3588><s%> can I answer <S%H6030><s%> Him, [And] choose <S%H977><s%> my words <S%H1697><s%> before <S%H5973><s%> Him?
"For though <S%H518><s%> I were right, <S%H6663><s%> I could not answer; <S%H6030><s%> I would have to implore <S%H2603><s%> the mercy <S%H2603><s%> of my judge. <S%H8199><s%>
"If <S%H518><s%> I called <S%H7121><s%> and He answered <S%H6030><s%> me, I could not believe <S%H539><s%> that He was listening <S%H238><s%> to my voice. <S%H6963><s%>
"For He bruises <S%H7779><s%> me with a tempest, <S%H8183><s%> And multiplies <S%H7235><s%> my wounds <S%H6482><s%> without <S%H2600><s%> cause. <S%H2600><s%>
"He will not allow <S%H5414><s%> me to get <S%H7725><s%> my breath, <S%H7307><s%> But saturates <S%H7646><s%> me with bitterness. <S%H4472><s%>

"If <S%H518><s%> [it is a matter] of power, <S%H3581><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> [He is] the strong <S%H533><s%> one! <S%H533><s%> And if <S%H518><s%> [it is a matter] of justice, <S%H4941><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> can summon <S%H3259><s%> Him?
"Though <S%H518><s%> I am righteous, <S%H6663><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%> will condemn <S%H7561><s%> me; Though I am guiltless, <S%H8535><s%> He will declare <S%H6140><s%> me guilty. <S%H6140><s%>
"I am guiltless; <S%H8535><s%> I do not take <S%H3045><s%> notice <S%H3045><s%> of myself; <S%H5315><s%> I despise <S%H3988><s%> my life. <S%H9132><s%>
"It is [all] one; <S%H259><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> I say, <S%H559><s%> 'He destroys <S%H3615><s%> the guiltless <S%H8535><s%> and the wicked. <S%H7563><s%>'
"If <S%H518><s%> the scourge <S%H7752><s%> kills <S%H4191><s%> suddenly, <S%H6597><s%> He mocks <S%H3932><s%> the despair <S%H9275><s%> of the innocent. <S%H9345><s%>

"The earth <S%H776><s%> is given <S%H5414><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the wicked; <S%H7563><s%> He covers <S%H3680><s%> the faces <S%H6440><s%> of its judges. <S%H8199><s%> If <S%H518><s%> [it is] not [He,] then <S%H645><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> is it?
"Now my days <S%H3117><s%> are swifter <S%H7043><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> a runner; <S%H7323><s%> They flee <S%H1272><s%> away, <S%H1272><s%> they see <S%H7200><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> good. <S%H9186><s%>
"They slip <S%H2498><s%> by like <S%H5973><s%> reed <S%H16><s%> boats, <S%H591><s%> Like an eagle <S%H5404><s%> that swoops <S%H2907><s%> on its prey. <S%H400><s%>
"Though <S%H518><s%> I say, <S%H559><s%> 'I will forget <S%H7911><s%> my complaint, <S%H7879><s%> I will leave <S%H5800><s%> off my [sad] countenance <S%H6440><s%> and be cheerful, <S%H1082><s%>'
I am afraid <S%H3025><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> my pains, <S%H6094><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that Thou wilt not acquit <S%H5352><s%> me.
"I am accounted wicked, <S%H7561><s%> Why <S%H4100><s%> then <S%H2088><s%> should I toil <S%H3021><s%> in vain <S%H1892><s%>?
"If <S%H518><s%> I should wash <S%H7364><s%> myself with snow <S%H7950><s%> And cleanse <S%H2141><s%> my hands <S%H3709><s%> with lye, <S%H1253><s%>
Yet <S%H227><s%> Thou wouldst plunge <S%H2881><s%> me into the pit, <S%H7845><s%> And my own clothes <S%H8008><s%> would abhor <S%H8581><s%> me.
"For [He is] not a man <S%H376><s%> as I am that I may answer <S%H6030><s%> Him, That we may go <S%H935><s%> to court <S%H4941><s%> together. <S%H9191><s%>
"There <S%H3426><s%> is no <S%H3808><s%> umpire <S%H3198><s%> between <S%H996><s%> us, Who may lay <S%H7896><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> upon us both. <S%H8147><s%>
"Let Him remove <S%H5493><s%> His rod <S%H7626><s%> from me, And let not dread <S%H367><s%> of Him terrify <S%H1204><s%> me.
"[Then] I would speak <S%H1696><s%> and not fear <S%H3372><s%> Him; But I am not like <S%H3651><s%> that in myself.
